sentences.chinese: 亂世之音怨以怒，其正乖；
sentences.literal: The sound of a chaotic age is resentful and angry, its correctness perverse;

sentences.chinese: 亡國之音哀以思，其民困。
sentences.literal: The sound of a perishing state is sorrowful and longing, its people distressed.
The way of sound and tone communicates with correctness.

sentences.chinese: 宮為君，商為臣，角為民，徵為事，羽為物。
sentences.literal: Gong represents the ruler, shang the ministers, jue the people, zhi affairs, yu things.

sentences.chinese: 五者不亂，則無惉懘之音矣。
sentences.literal: If these five are not chaotic, then there will be no sounds of worry and sorrow.
If gong is chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant;
If shang is chaotic then broken, its ministers ruined;
If jue is chaotic then sorrowful, its people resentful;
If zhi is chaotic then mournful, its affairs laborious;
If yu is chaotic then dangerous, its wealth depleted.

sentences.chinese: 五者皆亂，迭相陵，謂之慢。
sentences.literal: If all five are chaotic, mutually encroaching upon each other, this is called laxity.

sentences.chinese: 如此則國之滅亡無日矣。
sentences.literal: In this way then the state's destruction has no day left.

sentences.chinese: 鄭衛之音，亂世之音也，比於慢矣。
sentences.literal: The sounds of Zheng and Wei are the sounds of a chaotic age, comparable to laxity.

sentences.chinese: 桑閒濮上之音，亡國之音也，其政散，其民流，誣上行私而不可止。
sentences.literal: The sounds of Sang Jian and Pu Shang are the sounds of a perishing state; their governance scattered; their people flowing away; deceiving superiors and practicing selfishness without being able to stop.
All sound is that which is born from the human heart;
